newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Transaero Jan-April passenger volume up.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Transaero Jan-April passenger volume up.

text.p: Private Russian airline AO Transaero carried 353,438 passengers between January and April, up from 291,729 in the same period last year, a company spokswoman said on Monday.
She could not give the airline's cargo turnover for the period.
Transaero plans to start passenger flights to Taiwan, Hong Kong and Manchester, England later this year, she added.
Chief executive Alexander Pleshakov said recently the company would fly from Moscow to Taiwan once a week and to Hong Kong and Manchester twice weekly.
Transaero operates 14 aircraft, including five Boeing 737s, five Boeing 757s, three DC-10-30s and one Ilyushin Il-86 jet.
It plans to lease an additional Boeing 767 jet for long-range flights as well as several Boeing 737-400s for medium-range domestic and international flights.
Russia's Aeroflot International Airlines owns five per cent of Transaero.
